trial_identification.studytitle: Randomised controlled trial of arm training in patients with COPD
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of arm endurance training, arm strength training, or a combination of strength and endurance training on supported and unsupported arm exercise capacity and arm muscle strength in patients with COPD

interventions.interventions: Interventions: All subjects perform lower limb exercise training three times per week In addition subjects are randomally allocated to one of the following groups: Arm endurance training Arm strength training Arm endurance and strength training No arm training (Control Group)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Peak and endurance arm exercise capacity capacity
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measurements pre training and following an 8 week training program

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measurements pre training and following an 8 week training program.
Measurements pre training and following an 8 week training program.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Any musculoskeletal, neurological, cardiovascular limitations to arm exercise.

trial_design.concealment: the sequence was concealed in opaque envelopes until interventions were assigned
trial_design.sequence: Random number generation in blocks using the website www.randomization.com which is recommended as the best of the freely available, internet-based randomisation services (BMC medical Research Methodology 2004,4:26)
